did.head: Collection Summary
did.physdesc: moving images: 61 videocassettes (U-Matic) : sound, color ; 3/4 in.
moving images: 10 video reels : sound, color ; 1 in.
sound recordings: 2 sound discs (acetate) : analog ; 12 in.
graphic images: 133 photographs : prints, black and white, color.

corpname.part: Archive of Folk Culture, American Folklife Center, Library of Congress

did.abstract: Collection of video recordings, photographs, promotional and publicity materials, clippings, posters, and ephemera from the career of David Bromberg, musician, singer-songwriter, and luthier, from around 1962 to 2013, including recordings of his performances at concerts and folk festivals around the United States as well as overseas and various interviews with Bromberg. Includes photographs of other folk music and popular music performers.

controlaccess.head: Selected Search Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the LC Catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject or location, and by occupation and listed alphabetically.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Moving image material was arranged and described as a separate series (Series 1. Moving image items) before transfer to the Packard Campus for Audio-Visual Conservation. The rest of the materials are arranged into Series 2. Photographs, manuscripts, and sound recordings. Subseries within series 2 are arranged in groupings provided by the donor with descriptions at the item-level.
Physical numbering is not always consecutive due to the varying sizes of photographic prints and manuscripts.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: The collection was processed by Maya Lerman.

userestrict.head: Copyright Status
userestrict.p: Duplication of collection materials may be governed by copyright and other restrictions.

accessrestrict.head: Access and Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research; access to collection materials may be restricted. To request materials, please contact the Folklife Reading Room at http://hdl.loc.gov/loc.afc/folklife.contact

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: David Bromberg collection (AFC 2015/043), Archive of Folk Culture, American Folklife Center, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: David Bromberg was born on September 19, 1945, in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, and raised in Tarrytown, New York. He is a multi-instrumentalist, singer, and songwriter, and has collaborated with a a variety of musicians, including John Hartford, Willie Nelson, and Jerry Jeff Walker. Though he is known for the fingerpicking blues style he learned while studying under Reverend Gary Davis, Bromberg's music covers various American styles, such as bluegrass, country, jazz, and rock and roll. During a hiatus from his musical performance career, Bromberg became a violin expert, ultimately building an extensive collection of American-built violins and opening a violin sales and repair shop in Wilmington, Delaware, with his wife, Nancy Josephson.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection of video recordings, photographs, promotional and publicity materials, clippings, posters, and ephemera from the career of David Bromberg, musician, singer-songwriter, and luthier, from around 1962 to 2013, including recordings of his performances at concerts and folk festivals around the United States as well as overseas and various interviews with Bromberg. Includes photographs of other folk music and popular music performers.
